name: dialectal
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
belonging or relating to a dialect (= a form of a language that people speak in a particular part of a country): The children were using a dialectal variant of standard Hindi. Such dialectal variation is surprising on such a small island.
More examplesFewer examplesThis usage may be dialectal.The term "brogue" refers to a dialectal accent of English.Dialectal differences between Canadian and American English were judged to be irrelevant for this research.
